channel.title: Connecting to Tor before a Proxy
channel.description: Is it even theoretically possible to configure `User` → `Tor` → `Proxy` → `Internet` combination which tunnels entire Tor traffic through a Proxy within a Whonix GW so connection on WS will be proxified by default? According to Documentation, you can make this setup with `red socks`, but it must be installed in a Whonix WS, not GW.

item.title: Connecting to Tor before a Proxy
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Possible. See:

Whonix

Tunnels/Connecting to a proxy before Tor

Instructions on how to connect to a proxy before Tor (User → proxy → Tor → Internet)

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to Tor before a Proxy

item.title: Connecting to Tor before a Proxy
item.dc:creator: dondow17
item.description:
Is it even theoretically possible to configure User → Tor → Proxy → Internet combination which tunnels entire Tor traffic through a Proxy within a Whonix GW so connection on WS will be proxified by default? According to Documentation, you can make this setup with red socks, but it must be installed in a Whonix WS, not GW.
